title: Flight attendant tells of disturbing new way couples are joining mile high club
text:

A well travelled flight attendant has spoken of how risqué passengers are raising the saucy levels even higher with a new way to join the mile high club.

Almost as soon as humans found a way to rise up above the Earth they decided to incorporate sex into the equation.

The first example of what might be considered an entrance into the mile high club is recorded in a betting book for London gentleman's club Brook's.

The 1785 entry came two years after the first successful balloon ride and recalled how Lord Cholmondeley had been bet 500 guineas by Lord Derby to have sex 1,000 yards from the ground.

Oswald Boelcke called dibs on the first pilot to take a nurse up in his fighter plane, although some aviation enthusiasts doubt the logistics of two people sharing a small cockpit.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: Getty Images)

Since the advent of affordable commercial flights in the latter half of the 20th century however, air travellers have been getting their money's worth.

Now veteran crew member Heather Poole has spoken of an alarming new trend sweeping the world's cabins.

“One thing I’ve noticed is that more and more mile-high members are avoiding the bathroom altogether, preferring to do the deed in their seat," she wrote in her book Cruising Attitude.

“They’ll use a blanket to cover up, giggling and wiggling in the process, making a big public spectacle of themselves.

“As soon as one of us is clued in to what might be going on, we’ll spread the word and each take turns slowly passing by their seat as we investigate the matter further."

(Image: Getty Images/Caiaimage)

The mischievous air hostess explained how the couple will smile sheepishly as the attendants walk past, pretending everything is above board.

The American cabin crew member explained that why it isn't illegal to have sex on a plane, it is a federal offence not to comply with a member of staff's request.

At the beginning of September a couple accidentally won themselves national recognition when they were caught sneaking out of a plane toilet together.

The passengers were accused of joining the mile high club after spending about 10 minutes inside the locked lavatory.
description: Heather Poole dishes the dirt about saucy passengers in her book Cruising Attitude.
